newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: PT rises sharply on H1 profit optimism.
newsitem.headline: PT rises sharply on H1 profit optimism.

text.p: Portugal Telecom (PT) shares rose strongly on the Lisbon bourse and could test a record high of 4,180 escudos soon amid optimism ahead of the company's first half profits announcement, dealers said.
"PT already hit 4,120 escudos today and now will test the high, supported by the prospect of good first half results," said one dealer who asked not to be identified.

Another operator said: "Initially estimates were for consolidated net profit of 20 billion escudos, now we are looking at 23 billion and even up to 25 billion, and this positive outlook is pushing up PT shares."

PT has forecast a first half 1996 consolidated net profit of 20.5 billion escudos, which would represent a 39 percent increase over its first half 1995 profit. PT's first half results are due to be released on September 19.
PT shares stood at 4,119 escudos, up 49, in volume of 153,230 shares at 1205 GMT.
